name: bis(2-(dimethylamino)ethyl) ether
Reason: 2-dimethylaminoethyl groups can increase the melting point due to the additional molecular weight and rigidity. Each dimethylamino group can be estimated to add approximately +20 to +30°C. Additionally, the ether linkage can also contribute to the melting point due to the presence of a polar functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising it by approximately +10°C.
